Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kahlua Sombrero, please.

Quote.Speaker: Waiter
Quote.Text: All right, so just you tonight?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Actually, I am meeting somebody, but I'm a little bit early. Leaving my company. After 19 years.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I'll drink to that. I'm starting at a company this week.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, really?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: To begginings and endings.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And to middles, the unsung heroes. And to moms.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: The moms and the troops.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do not tell my fiance I'm drinking on a Wednesday.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [laughs] I won't... I don't know her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm moving out to the burbs... actually, I'm moving further than the burbs, I'm moving to Colorado.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Colorado! The sunshine state.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep. Don't mess with Colorado.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Doing some skiing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no. I don't want to end up like Sunny Bobo.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Well that's just good sense right there. Everyone I know who skis is dead.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, I would like to try the luge, through.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Try it once, you're hooked. That's my guess.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what I've heard.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I'm an olympics nut.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yeah? Me too. Summer or winter?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo/Michael
Quote.Text: [in unison] Summer!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [holds out fist] Knuckles! Actually, I gotta come around and give you...

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: You know, it's funny, I tried to get an animal olympics going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? What happened?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: You know, life happened. What are you gonna miss most about Scranton?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... wow. The mountains. Where things are.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: That's the way it goes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Man, he is late. I'm gonna call him. Do you mind? I'm sorry. [calls Deangelo, Deangelo's phone vibrates]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Excuse me. Hello? You running late?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm here. I'm right... I'm at the bar.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I'm at the bar too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are? What bar?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I'm at the bar. The bar that's located in the lobby of the hotel.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... do not see you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: How long have you...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm been here about... gosh, over half an hour.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Ok, me too.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo/Michael
Quote.Text: [looking up from phones in unison] Sorry...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What're you wearing?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I am wearing a grey suit, red tie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are we both at the right place?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Which place?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hear your voice.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I hear your voice, I see your lips moving.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I see your voice in the phone. Oh, man! [holds out hand] Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Deangelo Vickers.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow... that is insane! [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: That is insane, that is the right term. Let's get some Vodka up in this cranberry, and one for my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [entering Dunder Mifflin offices] Here we go! Are you ready?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I am ready.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright! Here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is it. What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oh, she'll do. She'll do just fine.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I am very much looking forward to tommorow. It feels like the culmanation of a lot of hard work, a lot of good fortune...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [pops up from below camera, and runs out of room]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Did that? Did that just happen?! [runs after Michael] We should.. we should write a movie or something! I'm serious!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Michael is leaving. And apparently they've already hired a new manager. And we're meeting him today. It's a lot to process. Paperwork wise.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [wearing wig] Nope! It's not Ashton Kutcher. It's Kevin Malone! Equally handsome, equally smart! [winks]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, everyone, as you know, one of my favorite things is fanfare for it's own sake. So, without further ado, let's start clapping! Presenting Deangelo Vickers!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [blinds roll down, Deangelo waving]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on out!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Hello! [opens door] How are you sir?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am well, sir, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Can I just say, I am so excited to be working here. Little bit about myself, I love the American Southwest, for starters. You may call them Arizona, New Mexico, Nevada, Utah, I call them heaven. I have a peanut allergy, something I live with, it's a part of me. I've learned to cope with it. What else, I'm just as comfortable at the ball game as I am at the opera. I was a-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did I want to be made manager? Sure. A great opportunity squandered? Absolutely. A crushing blow? Yes. Will I get over it? No. But life goes on. Not for me.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [drops papers as Deangelo walks by] I'll get that you guys. Don't... it's just... you know...

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [picks up paper] I'll help you.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, hi! [obviously flirting body language]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Hello!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Have we met before?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No, not officially, actually, I saw you walking out of the bathroom before.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Well, I guess I'll go back to my cave. It was really great meeting you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [offers Kelly the papers as she walks away]

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: And that is what you call a meet cute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And we talk for like 20 minutes, no clue it's Deangelo the whole time!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Kind of embarassing.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, that story makes you sound stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I happen to like the hilarious hijinx I get myself into. There he is! Deangelo, I was just telling them about last night, when we met. Remember that? That was crazy!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oh. [chuckles] That was... let's see, where's my replacement? Where's the guy I'm replacing? Why don't I look to the left? He's sitting right there! [office laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yeah... I know... that's what I was just saying... that's what...

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [silences Michael]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That exact situation is why I always carry around some of these. [holds up 'Hello, my name is..,'] nametags. Just in case. Because sometimes you just need to I.D. yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [laughs] Office funny guy! Always glad to have an office funny guy around!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wasn't even trying to make a joke. But I guess I've always been sorta quirky, offbeat, a little twisted.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is Jim and Pam, aka Jap. What started as an affair has blossomed into a family before our eyes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, it wasn't an affair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes it was.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But, no, but we are a family.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [points to picture of Cecelia] We made that.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Cecelia.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Well, congratulations. I have four kids of my own.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Really? Oh, my gosh! We just have the one, but she poops for four. [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh oh. Someone started off on the right foot with the new boss!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, they don't ever talk about careers that were made because of unplanned pregnancies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thanks for meeting me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? I'd come anywhere to see a turtle? Where'd you find him.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's no turtle, Michael. I just wanted to get you here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know me very well, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's because I'm your right-hand man, Michael, but I can't do it again. I can't do it again for a whole new guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Now I'm gonna have to go online and look at turtles or I'll be off all day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I want to be manager. I just don't understand why I wasn't even interviewed for the job. What's wrong? I was totally qualified, you were pushing for me.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: That apple looks delic!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I do a lot of portion control. I try to keep my daily calor intake under 1200. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Deangelo, you're going to starve to death. [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So you decided to have an orgy and not invite me? I call the middle!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's cool that you like the southwest. It's one of my favorite regions.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's one of my favorite regions? Did I just sound totally lame? No, I sounded good.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I love the desert. It's one of my favorite ecosystems.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Here's the great thing about the southwest; there's so much more than desert. Along the north rim of the Grand Canyon is a forest as lush as you've ever seen.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Burnt! It's lush, dummie. Hey, Deangelo, what do you think of bald people? I hate them.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Deangelo, I forget, did you mention you like politics?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I did not.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Cause I was thinking that you should meet my boyfriend, he's a state senator. I really think the two of you would hit it off. He's a great person to know.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Sounds very interesting, thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Erin. Ok, let me transfer you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Why do you use your name when you use the phone?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, that's how Pam does it. I just copy her. She's sort of a living legend.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Try it without using your name.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is... oh, I like it!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, how may I assist you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, assist.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I sorta like the old way.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I just prefer it without the name and I thought- I've got to start doing some managing at some point.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know, I'm sorry, but if it's not a big deal we should just-

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: And it really isn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is that good?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah, ok, good.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Well, I'd like to change it, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, whatever. Whatever you think will work.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I think a change would be nice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You can do the old way or whatever you think would work. [phone rings]

Quote.Speaker: Denagelo
Quote.Text: [whispering] Change it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [picks up phone] ...I'm so sorry. Sorry. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Hey, funny guy. Wanna have a little mid-day lawl here. Make me laugh, huh? What you got? I can't even look at you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Here we go... ok... what do African Americans call... [laughter]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Deangelo, did you order a barber?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. Put a pin on that, kid. Can't wait to hear the punchline.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Finish the joke, Andy. What do African Americans call?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I... don't know. Help me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [a barber enters the office for Deangelo] That is so badass. So hardcore.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, real cool. Real power move.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I saw a hawk today. Just sitting right there on the overpass. Looking at me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to Erin] Shave me. [walks into office with Deangelo] This is going to be funny! Looks like we are going to be shaving buddies!

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Ok, alright! I love it! I love it! Michael, this is Reggie. He is the #1 yelp reviewed shaver in Scranton. It's not even close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And this is Erin and she is going to shave my face. Here we go. [Erin puts too much shaving cream on Michael's face, none on the neck]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Alright. This is how we do it. Feels nice, doesn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It really does. This is luxery. Here we go. Ah, that is nice.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You wanted to talk to us Deangelo?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Ah, yes, please! Just cozy up there. Just thought we could have some rap sessions with smaller groups.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we don't really do rap sessions. We kinda do... [Erin shaves Michael] god... we sorta do more of like powwows or-

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Ok, then, powwows then, fine.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Deangelo, my mom just sent me this picture of Cece, it is so adorable.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, wait, little bit of backstory, she loves dogs. She calls them 'da-das'.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Da-das.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And what happens here is-

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: You know what, enough about your baby, ok? I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We were... I think she was just trying to-

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: No, no, no, I know what you're doing. Just quit it. I want to hear from the rank and file. How can I be the best manager for you all? What can I do better?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, everybody? You have to be honest, here. You can't say that everything is perfect. So, you know, come up with something.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, Deangelo, I'd say communication could be improved. People stopped reading memos, so everyone marks them urgent.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ok, you know what, I mark it urgent A, urgent B, urgent C, urgent D. Urgent A is the most important, urgent D you don't even really have to worry about.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Michael, can you stop talking now? I need to shave your lips.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't shave my lips.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [Andy walks into room] What's up?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't mean to go into a rant here, but...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wrote the perfect joke. Topical, edgy, funny.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ...I saw this thing on the news. Democrats want electric cars. Republicans don't. I'm thinking, 'how crazy is it that we have a car debate going on in a city known for gridlock.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Let's not talk politics in the office, ok? I like you better as a funny guy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [leans on table] I wasn't taking a position. It's just one of those things where- [table collapses under Andy]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [laughter] Now that's funny! That's funny! You walk much?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, right, I mean- [walks into door, jokingly]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Little click...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [pushing box into office] Deangelo, this box came for you.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Thank you. That's my stuff. Yeah. Michael, take a look at this.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Need a hand?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Oh, that'd be great, thank you Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, this office sort of has a perfect Feng Shui to it, so... you know, let's not go overboard with the re-decorating, and I'm still here-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [holds up painting of desert to office, who are impressed]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I still have to look at this stuff, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: So this is a ten-gallon hat, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Yep, ten-gallon hat. Technically, it only holds about three quartz. Little factoid.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Deangelo's great. I love the guy. But I'm not sure he's a great fit for the office. And also, I'm not sure if I love the guy.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl's sister
Quote.Text: [holds out cowboy boots for Darryl]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cool, cool. Alright, see you later.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl's sister
Quote.Text: Hey, hey, hey! [holds up set of pistols in holsters]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No, I'm good. Keep them.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Hey, funny man! Whatcha got for me? Make me laugh?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [mimes using a rope to pull himself forward to microwave] Let's see if they have my favorite teas in here... [throws tea packets into air, puts hand in unplugged toaster, pretends to be shocked, takes container of cheese-puffs and throws them into air, pours hot coffee on his pants]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [laughs] Drink some soap!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [drinks hand soap]

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: [laughter and applause]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I guess this is my life now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How do I become a manger at Sabre?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: First thing's first, thank you for coming here directly. I know you could have called Tallahassee but they would've just looped back to me, so, it's cool you recognized my role here.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I left a message at corporate.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ahh. There you go. Get a recommendation from Michael. That'll put you right on the shortlist for next time there's an opening.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can't you just use the recommendation you already have on file?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What recommendation?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: From when he recommended me to replace him.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: ...I'm sorry, I never know how to act in these awkward-type situations.

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: Best whale watching:

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Deangelo! Wanna meet Cece?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: That's a cute baby. Very cute baby. Adorable. Very cute.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you very much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: See, we knew it! If he just met her, he'd understand.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We're back in! Right?

Quote.Speaker: Deangelo
Quote.Text: I swear, that baby could be the star of a show entitled 'Babys I Don't Care About.'
